me.Abhigya.core.scoreboard

Class SimpleScoreboard

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.Abhigya.core.scoreboard.SimpleScoreboard

  • public class SimpleScoreboard
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a Simple Scoreboard that allows developers to add/insert/clear elements to/from its view.

      • addViewers

        public void addViewers(java.util.Collection<org.bukkit.entity.Player> viewers)
        Display this for the given players. Note that always that the method update() is called, all the viewers registered will automatically see the changes on the Scoreboard.

        Parameters:
        viewers - Collection of Player viewers

      • addViewer

        public void addViewer(org.bukkit.entity.Player... viewer)
        Display this for the given players. Note that always that the method update() is called, all the viewers registered will automatically see the changes on the Scoreboard.

        Parameters:
        viewer - Player viewer

      • removeViewers

      • set

        public void set(int index,
                java.lang.String text)
        Sets the text displayed at the given index, or null if to remove the text at the given index.

        You should call the method update() after calling this, to see the changes.

        Parameters:
        index - Index where to display the text
        text - Text to display

      • addAll

        public void addAll(int begin_index,
                   java.lang.String... elements)
        Appends all the given elements starting from the given 'begin_index'.

        You should call the method update() after calling this, to see the changes.

        Parameters:
        begin_index - Index where start appending the elements
        elements -

      • addAll

        public void addAll(java.lang.String... elements)

      • getNextEmpty

        public int getNextEmpty(int begin_index)
        Returns the index of the next null/whitespace element, or -1 if no null/whitespace elements was found. Note that this method will look for the next null/whitespace starting from the given 'begin_index'.

        You should call the method update() before calling this.

        Parameters:
        begin_index - Index where start looking for a null/whitespace element
        Returns:
        Index of the next null/whitespace element, or -1 if no null/whitespace elements was found.

      • getNextEmpty

        public int getNextEmpty()
        Returns the index of the next null/whitespace element, or -1 if no null/whitespace elements was found.

        You should call the method update() before calling this.

        Returns:
        Index of the next null/whitespace element, or -1 if no null/whitespace elements was found.

      • add

        public void add(int begin_index,
                java.lang.String text)
        Appends the given text to the entries of this at the index of the next null/whitespace element. Note that this method will look for the next null/whitespace starting from the given 'begin_index'.

        You should call the method update() after calling this, to see the changes.

        Parameters:
        begin_index - Index where start looking for a null/whitespace element.
        text - Text to append.

      • add

        public void add(java.lang.String text)
        Appends the given text to the entries of this at the index of the next null/whitespace element.

        You should call the method update() after calling this, to see the changes.

        Parameters:
        text - Text to append.

      • clear

        public void clear(int index)
        Removes the element at the given index.

        This method is the equivalent of using set(index, null).

        You should call the method update() after calling this, to see the changes.

        Parameters:
        index - Index of the element.

      • clearAll

        public void clearAll()
        Clears all the entries.

        You should call the method update() after calling this, to see the changes.

        This method is the equivalent of using addAll(0, new String[MAX_ELEMENTS]).

      • rangeCheck

        protected void rangeCheck(int index)
